oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hon. Walter Bitterlich, honorary citizen of Nashville, Tennessee, 1960 October 12
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Honorary Citizenship of Nashville for Walter J. Bitterlich, by Mayor Ben West on October 12th, 1960. Bitterlich, a renown Austrian forester, who invented the relascope, was born in 1908 in Reutte, Tirol, Austria. He descended from several generations of foresters and did much of his early work in the Tyrolean Alps of Austria. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 9 photograph negatives : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bitterlich, Walter; West, Ben, 1911-1974
